snippet: President Obama should resist pressure to weaken a promised executive order to bar federal contractors from discriminating against gay men, lesbians and transgender people.
abstract: Editorial urges Pres Obama to resist pressure campaign by some religious groups to weaken promised executive order that would prohibit federal contractors from discriminating against gay men, lesbians and transgender people in their hiring practices; holds that Hobby Lobby ruling, which served to embolden groups, does not justify retreat from order's goal of fairness for all.
lead_paragraph: President Obama should resist pressure to weaken a promised executive order to bar federal contractors from discriminating against gay men, lesbians and transgender people.

headline.seo: New Rules Should Ban Discrimination by Federal Contractors
